name: cmdr
tagline: An A/V control system built in Ruby with an HTML5 frontend
body:
##cmdr
cmdr is a touch-based A/V control system built from the ground up as a inexpensive alternative to enterprise control solutions.

cmdr was created by students working for [Information Technology Services](http://www.wesleyan.edu/its) at [Wesleyan University](http://www.wesleyan.edu). Built on a Ruby backend with a touch-oriented HTML5 interface, it is currently deployed in over 40 classrooms on our campus; all of which are maintained by our Instructional Media Services student programming group.

cmdr is split into three parts: 

[cmdr](https://github.com/wesleyan/cmdr): The daemon and touchscreen interface that runs on your typical cmdr controller.

[cmdr-server](https://github.com/wesleyan/cmdr-server): The central server for control and endoint administration, still a work-in-progress.

[cmdr-devices](https://github.com/wesleyan/cmdr-devices): Device drivers for hardware that cmdr currently supports.

###Contact Us
The best way to reach the team is via our mailing list: cmdr-project@googlegroups.com

Alternatively you can access the archive and post to the list at https://groups.google.com/d/forum/cmdr-project
